This function fits a Bayesian Generalized Additive Model with negative binomial distribution and array-specific shape parameters to model gene expression trajectories.

Source: R/model_functions.R
bayesian_gam_regression_nb_shape.Rd

This function fits a Bayesian Generalized Additive Model with negative binomial distribution and array-specific shape parameters to model gene expression trajectories.

Usage

bayesian_gam_regression_nb_shape(
  x,
  y,
  array_idx,
  n_knots = 5,
  n_samples = 2000,
  backend = "rstan"
)

Arguments

x

Numeric vector of pseudotime values

y

Numeric vector of gene expression counts

array_idx

Vector of array/batch identifiers

n_knots

Number of knots for the cubic regression spline (default: 5)

n_samples

Number of MCMC samples (default: 2000)

backend

Backend to use for Stan models ("rstan" or "cmdstanr", defaults to "rstan")

Value

A list containing:

fit

The fitted brms model object

array_weights

Data frame with array-specific weights based on shape parameters

diagnostics

Data frame with array-specific diagnostics

data

The data used for fitting
